meanings.definition: To fit (something) in a way that is not the original or intended way.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic backfitted the new engine into the old car.
meanings.sent2: The plumber backfitted the pipes to make them work in the renovated house.
meanings.sent3: Trying to backfit a square peg into a round hole just doesn't work!
meanings.sent4: She backfitted her old dress to match the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent5: The tailor backfitted the suit perfectly, making it look brand new.

meanings.definition: Fitted in a way that is not the original or intended way.
meanings.sent1: The backfitted shelf looked out of place in the modern room.
meanings.sent2: The backfitted parts of the machine caused it to malfunction.
meanings.sent3: His backfitted costume for the play was a hilarious sight on stage.
meanings.sent4: The backfitted extension on the house made it stand out in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The backfitted chair was uncomfortable due to its odd shape.
